results.title: Once were warriors (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Lee Tamahori, Robin Scholes, Avalon Studios, Communicado, New Zealand Film Commission and New Zealand On Air
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Duff’s controversial best seller, “Once Were Warriors” is an intense and powerful film that leaves audiences stunned with its uncompromising insight into the strength of Maori culture in the face of degrading urban ghettos and devastating family violence. Jake (Temuera Morrison) and Beth (Rena Owen) have been married 18 years and she still finds him irresistible. Jake is a muscular, handsome man who exudes an explosive sexual energy but spends most of the time at the pub, often proving his masculinity with his fists and regularly exploding into rages that leave terrible scars on Beth and his family.

results.title: Niok
results.brief_description: Tells the simple, enchanting story of Ayot and his friends who live in a Cambodian village. They capture a baby elephant they name Niok and bring him back as a pet. The other boys tire of Niok but Ayot teaches him to manage his own food, baths and follow him. The villagers complain about the elephant’s appetite for their grain and Niok is sold; but Ayok pursues the party, retrieves Niok at night from a ship and releases him at the temple where he had first captured him.

results.title: Nine from Little Rock
results.brief_description: A summary of the individual achievements of the nine African American students who entered the Central High School in Little Rock, Arkansas following the integration of the school in 1957.

results.title: Never a Backward Step
results.brief_description: Wryly satirical documentary on Lord Thomson of Fleet who discusses his life in the British press, television and financial fields. The extent and scope of his business interests are dramatically shown.

results.title: Naked killer
results.creator_credit: Clarence Fok Yiu, Jing Wong and Wong Jing's Workshop Ltd
results.brief_description: An amphetamine paced delight, this furiously edited Hong Kong film is about a group of killer female assassins who decide it is time to enact their revenge on the men who have obstructed their lives. The plot is largely preposterous but what is undeniable is the sheer pleasure taken by the film-makers in delivering a never-ending feast of action, spectacle, colour and martial arts fighting. Director Fok-Yiu is one of the talented South East Asian directors who have proven an influence on directors as diverse as Quentin Tarantino and Australia’s Geoffrey Wright. The film features a cold-blooded lesbian killer, Princess, who steals the show in a subversive feminist reworking of the karate “villain”. Though violent, the action is tongue-in-cheek. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Muppet Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Brian Henson, Martin G. Baker, Jim Henson Productions and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The Muppets cast off for the high-seas adventure in this swashbuckling send-up of Robert Louis Stevenson’s immortal tale. Cast features Tim Curry as Long John Silver and the voices of Billy Connolly, Jennifer Saunders, Kevin Bishop, Frank Oz.

results.title: Moonbird
results.brief_description: A colour cartoon of the fantasy of childhood. Two small boys, armed with rope, cage and bait, embark upon a night-time expedition to capture the nocturnal bird. A bird does finally appear. Making friends, the boys persuade the bird to go home with them. (Award: Venice)

results.title: Mike and Stefani (50th anniversary reissue)
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: ScreenSound Australia’s 50th anniversary reissue on video of this classic film about post-war refugees, also includes complete segments from the film magazine series ‘Australian Diary’. ‘Mike and Stefani’ chronicles the wartime separation of a young Ukrainian couple, their chance re-union in a refugee camp and their subsequent application to emigrate to Australia. The final scene of the film was structured around an actual interview which was filmed in Germany between a Ukrainian couple and an Australian immigration official. The details of the experiences of the couple, beginning with the pre-war period, were then re-constructed in an episodic, open-ended way characteristic of neo-realist films like ‘Bicycle Thieves’. The film aimed to encourage Anglo-Australians to accept the sudden influx of non-British immigrants in the immediate post-war years. Extensive support materials are available on the ScreenSound Australia website including biographies, primary source documents, textual description and analysis.

results.title: Middlemarch
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Louis Marks and BBC
results.brief_description: George Eliot’s veritable feast of literary delight, with a star studded cast and stunning locations. Early nineteenth century England is restless. Soon the Industrial Revolution will split its population apart - into two opposing factions: the conservatives and the liberals. The young ambitious Doctor Tertius Lydgate arrives in the town of Middlemarch to take up his new position as the local doctor and medical supervisor at the new hospital, his intention is “to do good small work for Middlemarch and great work for the world.” However he meets with resistance from many of the town’s dignitaries. Meanwhile Dorothea Brooke, ashamed of her privileged existence of comfort in her Uncle Arthur’s house, seeks a purpose to her young life and finds herself drawn to the scholarly Edward Casaubon. But on their honeymoon in Rome, it seems her blind faith may have been misplaced… And what of Casubon’s errant artist/writer nephew, the Byronic Will Ladislaw, who is unable to banish Dorothea from his thoughts? He waits in the wings for passion to take its course .
